measured_by: willingness to pay (WTP) via Becker-DeGroot-Marschak auction
justification: The paper explains that in the BDM task "participants report their 'willingness to pay' (i.e. subjective value) for food items."
Grabenhorst et al. (2008) "found that pleasantness ratings from tasting the stimuli were increased by the taste-related labels."
The same study noted that "intensity ratings were not" changed by the labels, indicating intensity was assessed with an explicit rating scale.
Nook and Zaki (2015) had participants "first rated how much they wanted to eat a series of foods," using these wanting ratings as the behavioural measure.

The article states that the anterior prefrontal cortex "was found to track information about the healthiness of the foods in the initial rating," implying healthiness was measured through participants’ explicit ratings.
